verses.verse: (The Joy of Forgiveness) Of David. A Maskil. (Ps 85.2) Happy are those whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
(Jn 1.47; 2 Cor 5.19) Happy are those to whom the LORD imputes no iniquity and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
(Ps 31.10; 38.8; 39.2, 3) While I kept silent, my body wasted away through my groaning all day long.
(Job 33.7) For day and night your hand was heavy upon me; my strength was dried up (Meaning of Heb uncertain) as by the heat of summer. Selah
(Lev 26.40; Ps 103.12) Then I acknowledged my sin to you, and I did not hide my iniquity; I said, “I will confess my transgressions to the LORD,” and you forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah
(Ps 69.13; 144.7; Isa 43.2) Therefore let all who are faithful offer prayer to you; at a time of distress, (Cn: Heb at a time of finding only) the rush of mighty waters shall not reach them.
(Ex 15.1; Ps 31.20; 121.7) You are a hiding place for me; you preserve me from trouble; you surround me with glad cries of deliverance. Selah
(Ps 25.8; 33.18) I will instruct you and teach you the way you should go; I will counsel you with my eye upon you.
(Jas 3.3) Do not be like a horse or a mule, without understanding, whose temper must be curbed with bit and bridle, else it will not stay near you.
(Prov 16.20; Rom 2.9) Many are the torments of the wicked, but steadfast love surrounds those who trust in the LORD.
(Ps 64.10) Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, O righteous, and shout for joy, all you upright in heart.
